result.execSummary:
The defendant Kraig K. Hoepner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + Court appointed Attorney fees; due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.  

If alternate has to be served, sentence may transfer to Waukesha or Washington County, as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized. 

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

No DNA Sample ordered

**PER 6-30-2016 ORDER - Attorney fees in the amount of $498.82 assessed**

records.addlTxt: To Defendant from Bookkeeping regarding attorney fees
Order for payment of Atty. Michael C Witt  as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $498.82.
Reminder Notice
with attachments for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Michael Witt in the amount of $498.82 .
Criminal Case Settlement
with JI

Case called at 1:29 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kraig K. Hoepner in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt informs the Court that the plea questionnaire is previously dated as it was submitted but returned as the reserve Judge had questions for the State, resubmits to the Court
Court clarifies that issue was regarding victim rights at last hearing; Victim Rights Compliance Verified by ADA Shock; submits victim impact statement

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
The Court finds that Mr. Hoepner has been properly charged as/convicted as repeater
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + Court appointed Attorney fees; due in $30 incriments per month, beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.  If alternate has to be served, sentence may transfer to Waukesha or Washington County, as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized. Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

No DNA Sample ordered
Recess: 1:52 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 9:27am. 
Defendant Kraig K. Hoepner in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Witt submits paperwork for the entry of a change-of-plea, including a Criminal Case Settlement form that involves a plea to Count #2 and then a costs-only sentencing recommendation. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.  
In response to the Court's inquiry about the victim's position on the costs-only sentence recommendation, ADA Teuber indicates that the victim did not respond to the initial inquiry, so the victim has not been notified about today's hearing or about the terms of the Criminal Case Settlement. 
Attorney Witt provides information on the bases for the stipulated sentence-recommendation.
The Court indicates that the Court will not proceed with the plea-sentencing hearing today; the State is to contact the victim to confer regarding the proposed sentencing recommendation.    
The Court inquires of Mr. Hoepner regarding his non-payment of the attorney fee installments.  Mr. Hoepner acknowledges that he has not made the required payments. 
Attorney Witt provides information on Mr. Hoepner's financial situation. 
The Court indicates that it will not take any action on the non-payment of the attorney fee installments today; instead this will be addressed at the next hearing.  
The Court returns the plea-related paperwork to Attorney Witt.
recess 9:34am.

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on 6/9/16 at 1:30pm- send notices (JA- please note in comments that the Court needs to address payment of court-appointed attorney fees)
Court's response to Bookkeeping Memo : Set a hearing to address non-compliance
Payment hearing on May 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
from Bookkeeping to the Court regarding failure to comply with Court Order
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 02:40 pm.

Defense stands mute;  Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:24pm [mo]
Defendant Kraig K. Hoepner in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Hoepner. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed

Mr. Hoepner submits a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel
---Mr. Hoepner is sworn by the Court that all information in true and correct

The Court grants Mr. Hoepner's Petition for Court Appointed Counsel; Mr. Hoepner is to repay his attorney fees at the rate of $30 per month beginning on 1/29/16 and on the 29th of each month until otherwise directed by the Court. 


The Court requires $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--No Contact with Melissa Kieckhefer
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:41pm


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearnce on 2/16/16 at 2:00pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
